intro: Pentaschistis humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's pentaschistis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
